alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Isle of Wight; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 12:36PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gloucester, northeastern Isle of Wight, and southeastern York Counties and the City of Newport News through 115 PM EST... At 1236 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rescue, or near Smithfield, moving north at 30 mph. This storm has exhibited weak rotation aloft at times. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Smithfield, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Seaford, Gloucester Point, Rescue, Wicomico, Achilles, Lee Hall, Denbigh, Tabb, Beaconsdale, Fort Eustis, Carrollton, Lackey, Benns Church, Glass and Naxera. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for eastern and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; Isle of Wight; Newport News; York
